We actually got overrun by older adults in the hot tub, as if we shouldn't have been in there with our children, who were actually just sitting there! The rooms do not have free internet and their business center is small-wouldn't have been able to get onto a computer even if we tried! Overall, the experience was fantastic and we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice lodging, bad timing”
Reviews.Author: Late-Arrival
Reviews.Content: We decided it would be nice to spend a weekend in Indianapolis and stay at a decent motel. The lodging was as advertised, except for the fact that loaded with mid-school age soccer players. It would be difficult to rate the breakfast - which appears to receive high marks from others - because it was crowded with long lines. At least there were restaurants within walking distance. Same goes for the pool and hot tub. Absolutely packed with kids during the time of our stay. Nothing against the kids, who were fine. But it did mean that what we paid a premium for services and facilities which we were unable to utilize. Also could not access the workstations at the business center. For the same reason, lots of kids checking their email and updating their facebook pages. I would probably stay there again, although never during a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! I will be staying there again.”
Reviews.Author: funfunfun050473
Reviews.Content: We go to Indianapolis a few times a year to visit friends and take in some great restaurants. We always make it like a small 1 night vacation. We stayed here in April 2009. I thought the hotel was clean and pretty. It had a very relaxing charm to it. The pool was a little smaller than it appeared in the photo, but was still fine. The hotel was older, but it had a lot of upgrades. You can tell how it was redone in alot of areas. Furniture by the pool was newer, the rooms all were remodelded. Loved the managers reception. I had a margarita on the rocks. They served chips and salsa and a few other things. They had popcorn also. All for free. Breakfast was wonderful. Loved My omelet. If you are looking for a great restaurant close by, go to BRAVO. It is Italian, and has always been one of my favorite places. It is located on 86th steet the next block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Embassy!”
Reviews.Author: JulesB11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here April 10th and 11th--the 10th for our granddaughter's 5th birthday and the 11th by ourselves (we sent them home)! The twins have been to this hotel 2 other times and always want to go back. In fact, they chose it for their birthday get-away because they love Sweety! All three of our grandkids love the swimming pool, the drinks and snacks in the evening, and the wonderful breakfast! They didn't want to leave. We were going to take them somewhere for dinner and they didn't want to leave, so we ate at Ellington's--the restaurant in the hotel! Great food and great service! My husband and I had room service there the following evening--really good pizza! Front desk staff were all very nice. The room was very clean--newly remodeled. We enjoyed eating at the big table and having the DVD player in the room. We have been here several times and will most certainly return! One of my granddaughters threw a coin into the fountain and wished "that we could stay here forever!"

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Renovated Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: kwddp
Reviews.Content: The hotel has gone under extensive renovations and it is really nice now. Have a wonderful exercise room. Front Desk people were very friendly and we always enjoy the complimentary breakfast. There also was a complimentary business center right on the first floor that was very convenient. Our kids also really love the Macaw that is in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Free Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PnC_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Fantastic breakfast made to order. Also had a great free happy hour. Just chips and veggies, but any drink you like was provided. Bermuda Triangle was very popular. Room was above average. Carpet had a large spot and the bathroom counter appeared to be in need of repair. Internet was available at $10 a day. Overall a very nice place and plan to stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Needs cleaning ... lots of it”
Reviews.Author: BarefootTom
Reviews.Content: I hate to say it, but this hotel is just DIRTY. From the elevator, to the lounge tables to the rooms, it needs a good cleaning and, while they're at it, new carpets, drapes and curtains. The breakfast service comes with a snarl from the cook, the parrot in the atrium (who begins screaming at 5 a.m.) is not treated humanely and while signs in the lounge state that the hotel is undergoing renovations, no improvements are obvious. Only Rachel at the front desk was a plus for this tired, worn property. Hilton, send an inspector to check this place out. I will definitely stay elsewhere next time in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay!”
Reviews.Author: carotgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2-year old daughter stayed in this lovely hotel for the weekend 11-13 April 2008. We enjoyed very much the atrium space, fountains and decor. The room was perfect for us - two adjoining spaces - our daughter was able to sleep in the living area on the couch while we were able to watch movies in the bedroom area without disturbing her. Two downfalls: they do offer a lovely hot buffet breakfast - complete with omelette station. My husband ordered an omelette and could not eat it due to the fake oil/grease they use to 'butter' the pan. Yuck! Also - the second day - Sunday morning - the hot tub was out of service, with no explanation or attention from the staff. Neither of these things would keep me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Keystone_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Hands down, this is my favorite Embassy Suites hotel, to date. The exterior architecture is unique and quite pleasing. Front staff personnel were friendly and helpful; check-in process was uneventful (as it should be!). Not sure how old the hotel is; however, it had the appearance of a newer property or at least one that is maintained very well. The condition of my room was excellent; I couldn't find a blemish. The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable; bathroom was clean; shower water pressure is strong. I like how you can open a french door to a small exterior balcony. It was very warm the day I stayed, and it was very nice to be able to open the door and enjoy the balmy breezes blow into the room. For a moment it didn't feel as if I were in Indianapolis. Granted, the view from my third floor suite was nothing special and brought things back to reality. Access to I-465 or 86th Street is very easy. I did not avail myself to the other amenities, including breakfast, on the property. I can not pass up a Cracker Barrel breakfast (located just around the corner!); otherwise, I would have had the good breakfast at the hotel. Overall, an excellent choice for accommodations on the north side of town.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: studlyIllinois
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our final stop on a whirlwind seven day trip to upstate New York and then back to Illinois. We chose this hotel so we could have one quiet night to just sit back and relax. This hotel turned out to be all we'd hoped for & more. Embassy Suites are beautfiul hotels anyhow, but this one in the north section of Indianapolis was fantastic. Our room was quiet, the front desk people were extremely courteous & helpful. We just had a perfect evening before heading back out for home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility For Families”
Reviews.Author: WishYouWereHere-2
Reviews.Content: We received a two night stay at the Embassy Suites North as a gift for our family. We chose to stay during the week after Easter. It appears that most renovations have been completed. In fact, there was no construction visible from the lobby or atrium. Our room contained two double beds and a sleeper sofa with a full door in between. It seemed to be generously sized (bigger than what I remember the Embassy Suites in downtown Indy being) Our room was very clean at check in, but missing all the pillows from both beds. A quick call to the front desk remedied that. The sleeper sofa was adequate for our 10 year old son, but looked to be uncomfortable for an adult. He was awoken each morning by people in the atrium moving tables around. Because we were on the second floor, we did not have an outdoor balcony. When we checked out our view, we noticed that window did not latch properly nor did it have a screen. We also noted that it was accessible from the side parking lot by a low roof. It did feel a little unsafe. Housekeeping Service was still not complete by 5:00 on day 2 of our stay, but again a call to the front desk fixed that. The free cocktails offered in the evenings from 5:30-7:30 had adequate chips/pretzels and dip as well as a great selection of drinks. The free breakfast in the morning was outstanding with made-to-order omelets and french toast available along with the traditional breakfast items (cereal, bacon, eggs, pancakes, donuts, waffles). The pool is very appealing to families. It is only 3.5 feet deep throughout. Deep enough to have a good time, but not so deep that you worry about the kids the whole time. The work out area was viewable from the pool. It looked to have 3 pieces of equipment in a very small glassed in room with a TV. Because we were there during Spring Break, there were many families. At times the pool area was crowded and the hallways noisy. By our second night the business crowd had arrived and things were much more relaxing. I would definitely stay here again. I would recommend this hotel for families - the breakfast can't be beat. Business travelers who like peace and quite should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “in need of TLC”
Reviews.Author: hiltonloyaltillnow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because Homewood suites by Keystone got a number of bad reviews. Wish we would have stayed at Homewood, This place needs a lot of paint,carpet repair,cleaning.It was out of control the weekend we stayed,children running up and down the halls till very late, the fire alarm was pulled 3differnt times Saturday night 12-08-07 probably would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: pdtraveller
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites North in Indianapolis is a good value for the money. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The room itself was recently updated and very comfortable. The bathroom is somewhat small, but clean and modern. The area around the hotel offers many choices for restaurants. In addition, the hotel offers a decent breakfast every morning as part of the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, will be even better soon”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMom
Reviews.Content: Our family of four does seek out Embassy Suites when we travel. We take full advantage of both the manager's reception and full cooked to order breakast. This ES did not dissapoint. The design is more Spanish Floridian than Indiana Hoosier, and very nice. We had a room on the highest renovated floor #615. Despite a hotel full of preteen soccer tournament boys, our room was quiet and comfortable. The common eating areas were spaced nicely, so we did have privacy, and the decor was very pleasant with lots of greenery. The hotel staff was all very accomodating and friendly, the pool while not huge was big enough for my daughters to have fun in. This hotel will be even nicer once the renovations are complete, but I would recommend this place even now.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but in old room”
Reviews.Author: jeko
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for a weekend. The hotel was undergoing renovations. We were in an older room that clearly needed an update. That said, there was nothing wrong with the room. It was clean and still a pleasant experience. I must say, I was not used to the layout in that the entry door is glass and there are two floor to ceiling windows on each side of the door. The curtains offer more than adequate privacy, but it still does not feel as secure or private as a standard, solid door. I liked the atrium/central courtyard. As noted, behind the elevator there was a parrot in a large cage there. It did not smell and the cage was clean. The kids loved it. Pool was average -- par for the course. I felt the breakfast was better than usual. There was a small grill for ordering to suit. There was also a slightly better than average buffet. This is a nice hotel. Clearly the strategy is to get one of the new rooms/suites.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!”
Reviews.Author: SpongeBob69
Reviews.Content: On arrival at night the first impressions of the hotel seemed fine, but realised why they took the web picture at night as in the morning everything looked shabby. The breakfast area was in the atrium and felt like you were in a prison block (not that i have been in one) and was basic, as was the food. The waitress looked about 90 and was wiping the tables with a rag and bucket of dirty water and at one point dropped the serving tongs for the bacon on the floor and picked it up and put it back in! When breakfast finished at 9.30am they could not wait to get you out. The rooms were nice enough but the bathroom was small and the ventilation poor. The pool looked dirty and uninviting and the gym area was squashed in one corner. They were also carrying out a refurbishment, which we were not told about and was very noisy if trying to sleep in.When we complained and asked for a reduction they offered us a $50.00 voucher to eat at their in house restaurant, which no one went in!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites North and it was wonderful. They have just renovated and the rooms and I dont know how the hotel was before that, but now they are first rate. The beds are very comfortable, all the furniture is modern and new. Fantastic amenities, nice bathroom, nice lobby. The fitness center is a bit small but I think they are updating that next. This was a very comfortable place to stay for a couple of days on business. I wish all embassy suites had the same decor and amenities this one has now.

Reviews.Title: “Wait until renovations are completed”
Reviews.Author: Colorobo
Reviews.Content: I come to Indianapolis frequently for buisness. I often meet at the Holiday Inn on Michigan Ave near the Pyramids. I stopped staying there because of the large number of families with kids who come to the water park there. I chose the Emassy Suites about a 1/4 mile away as an alternative. I have stayed there 4 times. It is undergoing reservations, although their website would never tell you that. As a Hilton Platinum member they put me on the 8th floor where there is hardwired (ethernet) internet access. This is important since their wireless network has significant problems. I found out on subsquent visits that there are some "hardwired" rooms on other floors. If internet is important and you must stay here then request a hardwired room. OK, the rooms, most haven't been updated since early 80's when the hotel was built,. Dirty carpets, small bathrooms, 19 inch TV's. Breakfast is your generic Sysco stuff. I imagine once the renovations are completed this should be an adequate place to stay. For now, on future stays I'll choose of the 2 nearby Hampton Inn's or the Doubletree nearby.

Reviews.Title: “improved since 2006 but desk attitudes are worst”
Reviews.Author: hoosierscience
Reviews.Content: The rooms are cleaner, but furniture is old and need to be freshen. The breakfast is ok, but poorly organized. The staff is wonderful, but the desk staff can be very surly and rude. Ventilation of the rooms, is limited by opening the windows, and bedding is old and tired looking. Walls tend to be thin and the atrium does get noisy. If you are on a budget, and need to cut corners this place is fair. I stayed here because of convention, but next time I will stay at the other hotel and not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most run-down Embassys I've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: BL24
Reviews.Content: As a frequest traveler who prefers to stay in Hilton brand hotels, this is perhaps the most disappointing property I've been to. I'm not one who typically writes bad reviews, but the entire hotel is poorly lit and is way past it's prime. It appears they may be just starting to begin some room renovations whch are desperately needed. The heating unit in my room was the loudest I've ever heard- louder than those window-type A/C units and the heater wasn't even that style- it was a central heating unit that rattled and vibrated all night long. The bathroom was tiny, but the rooms were larger than a lot of the other Embassy Suites I've been to which was a bonus. The very worst thing about my stay was the room next to me had their refrigerator die out on them causing a horrible burnt stench for my entire overnight stay and into the next morning. The fitness center is about the size of a walk in closet at best. The only thing this hotel has going for it is a very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: CountessCeprano
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot on business, so I'm fairly discriminating when it comes to hotels. This hotel exceeds in the following areas: 1) staff efficiency and friendliness 2) cleanliness of rooms 3) size of rooms 4) comfort of mattress 5) thick, plentiful towels I'd like to add that I inadvertently left two very important items in my room upon checkout. I called the hotel the next day, was put in touch with housekeeping, and was informed within 24 hours that my items were found. As I requested, the hotel shipped the items to me in a very timely fashion, and they notified me that the package was en route. This is outstanding service by any hotel's standards. I'm quite impressed with the management of this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor for Embassy Suite standards”
Reviews.Author: FrqTravlr
Reviews.Content: We stayed hear on the last night of our 10 day family vacation. We had cable problems as soon as we checked in and it was obvious the hotel expected it. There was a laminated card on the desk telling us to contact the front desk if we had cable problems. We contacted them and some of the problems were fixed but they never followed up. That night, they had an event in the atrium area untilkafter midnight which made it extremely difficult for our children to sleep. Anyone who takes the time to laminate a card regarding a problem in the hotel rather than fix the problem doesn't understand the service business. Stay away from this beast!
